name: SpaceBear
description: A 2D platformer made using a JavaScript library called codeheart.js. Made in 36 hours with two teammates during a summer camp at Michigan State University.

name: Quizlexa
description: Won ninth place at Spartahack 2. An (unpublished) Alexa skill + companion webapp for practicing Quizlet digital flash cards.

name: Running Calculator
description: I wrote this JFX application to help my high school cross country coach with managing and planning workouts for our team. It even has CSV import/export support.

name: now-playing: Spotify for Bash
description: A command line tool to control basic Spotify playback in the Bash terminal (play/pause, skip, seek, view current song). Built using cURL and a lightweight ExpressJS server. Click here for the GitHub repo.

name: Michigan Hackers Website
description: A ReactJS frontend, Go backend brochure website for Michigan Hackers at the University of Michigan. I was the backend developer and lead frontend developer of this website. Click here to see the website!

name: Talks for Video Game Music Club
description: As the president and co-founder of the Video Game Music Club at the University of Michigan from 2018 to 2021, I helped prepare a talk for (nearly) every weekly club meeting. Click here to view some of the talks we've given!

name: FAMNM Website
description: I was the webmaster of three years for the FIRST Alumni and Mentors Network at Michigan (FAMNM), a volunteer group at the University of Michigan that mentors local robotics teams. Click here to see the website I maintain.

name: Metroid (NES) Remake
description: As a project in EECS 494: Game Development at the University of Michigan, I (along with a partner), recreated the Brinstar area from Metroid in Unity. Click to download (for Windows and Mac)

name: The Archive Album
description: All of the music I arranged/composed in 2016 and 2017, all in one album. A mishmash of covers and original work.

name: The Castle
description: A tone-poem I wrote in early 2019, inspired by depictions of Dracula's Castle (especially depictions from the Castlevania series)

name: Robot Rescue Original Soundtrack
description: Soundtrack for the second place game at the Global Game Jam 2020 (Ann Arbor site). Composed from scratch in 48 hours.

name: vimtalk
description: A talk I wrote to introduce computer science students at the University of Michigan to the vim text editor

name: GridBeat
description: GridBeat is a Picross-inspired music-education rhythm puzzle game I created during an independent study at the University of Michigan. Available on Google Play Store

name: TURBONEON
description: A multiplayer racing game made for my senior capstone class at UMich. It won first place at the December 2019 Student Game Showcase! I was composer, sound designer, and developer.

name: Xenoblade Chronicles Chill Covers
description: Some chill covers I did of tracks from the Xenoblade Chronicles soundtrack during 2020.

name: Musical Anthology 2020-2021
description: Music that I made during 2020 and 2021.

name: The Next Fi
description: Some background music I made for The Next Guy (Oliver Barnum) on YouTube (his channel is linked on the bandcamp page)

name: Democracy Bus
description: Variations on 'Wheels on the Bus' written for a game jam amongst employees at Roblox!

name: THE CYBERRATS RADIO HOUR (Original Score)
description: Tracks I wrote for the CYBERRATS RADIO HOUR, an audio play in the setting of the tabletop roleplaying game Cyberrats. Link in album description.

name: Endless Reverie
description: JRPG-inspired music composed across 3 years for the JRPG-inspired D&D campaign I played in with my friends.

name: RMFP Bot
description: A continouously deployed TypeScript Discord bot for a weekly competition in a cooking community.

name: CYBERRATS RADIO HOUR: EPISODE 2 (Original Score)
description: The music for the sequel to CYBERRATS RADIO HOUR!

name: self-hosting configs
description: A collection of the scripts and configurations I use for my self-hosted Kubernetes cluster on my home server.
